instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on
threads.message: I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that's not turning on. Light liquid-damage. I cleaned up the few seemingly meaningless, slightly ugly components. No change. No <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>. No <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>. Has PPBUS at 12.59V and 3V42. Has MagSafe light. No cycling. No shorts on CPU, which is rare with this model. No other shorts that I can find. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is fine. Not sure where to go next. Any thoughts?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on
threads.message:
Original 85W charger?
Does it charge battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> present?
RTC signals OK?
Pins 1 & 12 of <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on
threads.message:
Power on sequence cannot start without <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>.
Reflow SMC at least; I recommend you to reball it.
